text:
Hi, I got one simple problem and can't quite get it. I got Nav bar menu  one of the li element have dropdown li elements but,No matter how I set it with Jquery (onclick hover) or with CSS display:none e.t.c when i point mouse over, it automatically shows dropdown menus  But I want when i click it then to show it not default automatic hover.

thanks in advance
Hey <@UGJ3XBBGF> A link to a page would be helpful to get an exact answer for you, but have you tried targeting the `:hover` pseudo selector?

<@UFBNA9K9A> Sorry almost forgot Thank yea here it is

<https://info.thecontractchair.co.uk/blog>

When you bring mouse to "Furniture" its shows automatically meanwhile

here just need to click and shows

<https://www.thecontractchair.co.uk/#furniture-submenu>

yea I tried :hover too it still shows hover or not
so here is the selector that I found when doing an inspect element that’s triggers the hover show `.grid-header-wrapper .hs-menu-wrapper ul li:nth-child(2):hover>ul`
the tough part is that the display:block is marked with `!important`
What you need to do is modify the CSS of the navigation module to fit your needs since you won’t be able to override with other CSS
<@UFBNA9K9A> Thank you very much I just Found !important  issue and now trying to fix it Then I'll look up in module modify and respond as soon as I can
<@UFBNA9K9A> Sorry to bother you again. but how do you mean modify navigation module by this main  or (rounded with red line) by that?
Hey <@UGJ3XBBGF> no bother at all, I’m here to help.  I mean more the code that’s in the center of the screen. That CSS section
since you can’t override it just change it
you have access to the source now so you can make it do whatever you want
Thank you very much I appreciate it.
Sure thing, let me know if you have any other questions

I have a client that is looking to build a ROI calculator, and on submit have that information stored in HubSpot. Then finally have the results of the calculator emailed to the individual that filled it out’. Has anyone else tacked a project like this? Any best practices or insights you can provide?

Here is the calculator: <http://www-topyx-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-b4f7776c-8d56-475d-865b-888e8d61da23?hs_preview=azIAfWbw-6405242970>. Right now the result is rendering on the page - however they would like the result to be emailed to the client after submit

I would use the form submissions endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3> to write the results to the contact record so they can be used as personalization tokens in the email
That feels like the path of least resistance but let me know if you have any questions
Thanks Zack - this is really helpful

Hey <@U2LEJ045D> that sounds like a similar project I have worked in the past. We use to add in a hidden field on the HubSpot form where we store the results right before the form is actually submitted. That way, we could pull the result from that contact's property into an email.
